name: Pothos
description: Long the reigning king of the houseplants, this attractive vining plant comes in many different varieties.

name: Snake Plant
description: They have a striking architectural form that ranges from a few inches to a few feet tall.

name: Monstera
description: Also known as Swiss cheese plant (for all the holes in its leaves!), this is a dramatic-looking favorite.

name: ZZ Plant
description: ZZ plant, which is short for Zamioculcas zamiifolia, is one of the easiest plants to grow.

name: Peace Lily
description: Peace lilies have glossy green leaves and pretty spoon-shaped white flowers.

name: Aloe Vera
description: Aloe vera grows in the landscape in warm climates, and in the household in cold climates.

name: Moth Orchid
description: This orchid may look exotic, but it's actually a reliable bloomer with the proper conditions.

name: Peperomia
description: This succulent, which remains a small houseplant, has exploded in popularity the past few years.

name: Norfolk Pine
description: Norfolk pine are attractive little trees that have soft needles and an elegant form.

name: Money Tree
description: Popular since the 80s, this plant may have a braided stem or bonsai form.

name: Senecio
description: Succulents of all sorts have been extremely popular in recent years, but these are must-haves.

name: Christmas Cactus
description: Native to Brazil, this succulent can live for decades and is available in a number of pretty colors.

name: Philodendron
description: With both upright and climbing types, you canâ€™t go wrong with philodendrons!

name: African Violet
description: These old-fashioned favorites have violet flowers that bloom just above the evergreen foliage.

name: Rubber Tree
description: This handsome plant has glossy, leathery leaves that have made it popular for decades.
